intro: Gratiola aspera, commonly known as the rough yellowroot, is a perennial herb native to North America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. Its roots are tuberous and have a distinct, peppery flavor, which has been used in traditional herbal medicine. Gratiola aspera thrives in moist, woodland environments and is often found in shaded, well-drained soils.
